wikipedia_page.main: Mary Pilling (born 14 December 1938) is an English former cricketer who played primarily as a right-arm pace bowler. She appeared in 11 Test matches and 9 One Day Internationals for England between 1963 and 1978, and captained England at the 1978 World Cup. She played domestic cricket for Kent.
